clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: The most common indication for the usage of amylocaine was spinal anesthesia A32277

contraindications.disease: A lack of detailed information regarding the specificities of amylocaine relate to a lack of information on its pharmacokinetics at the time of its primary use in the early 1900s T146
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Like all other local anesthetics amylocaine acts as a membrane stabilizing drug that reversibly decreases the rate of depolarization and depolarization of excitable membranes A32278 In this way the conduction of neuronal signals for certain bodily movements can be blocked A32278 In particular when administered for spinal anesthesia the resultant anesthesia can typically extend from the chest to the legs A32278
